revised_title: Design and Synthesis of Conjugated Hydrocarbon Polymers for Nonlinear Optics
tldr: This paper discusses the design requirements for polymeric nonlinear optical materials and progress in the synthesis of conjugated hydrocarbon polymers. The author focuses on the synthesis and properties of polyacetylene, polyparaphenylene, and poly(paraphenylene vinylene) and their potential applications in optoelectronics and nonlinear optics. The paper also highlights the challenges in processing and fabricating these materials for practical applications.
